channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Scrapyard operating in residential square, 3rd January
item.description:
There is a giant fly-tip and a commercial scrapyard being operated out of it on this residential square. Dangerous metal objects and bits of machinery are out in the open to be taken as weapons. The scrap metal is routinely sold and picked up here

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Richmond Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken shopping trolley, 3rd January
item.description:
Please collect

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ethelbert Road, Plaistow, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sheet of solid ice, 3rd January
item.description:
Someone washed their car and it’s left a sheet of solid ice outside in the road preventing residents from leaving our houses as it’s like an ice rink. My husband is disabled and relies on driving but it’s too dangerous to step outside at the moment Please send a gritter lorry up to help us get out Our property is at the top of a slight hill

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gattons Way, North Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping ex cab office, 3rd January
item.description:
A large amount of rubbish has been fly tipped in the grounds of what used to be a cab office on Herbert Road. It looks like the building is no longer in use. It is getting worse by the day.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Herbert Road, Woolwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Black ice needs clearing, 3rd January
item.description:

item.title: Amigo House Bin Chamber needs cleaning, 3rd January
item.description:
This bin chamber is on the side of Amigo House and enables residents to dispose of rubbish via the chute. The floor is very dirty and requires cleaning, so it doesn't attract rats.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dibden Row, Elephant and Castle, Greater London

item.title: Car parked in free parking bay for over 2 months, 3rd January
item.description:
